channel.title: Quenching your BMS Thirst.
channel.description:
So this game is getting closer to release, possibly... it might even be released by THIS Christmas, failing that, maybe before March next year, So what are you going to be playing to Quench the much needed thirst of BMS withdrawal?
I'm tempted to get a PS Vita, a pre-owned one is under £200, and there is a few nice games for it, obviously by March next year there will be more. I dont know if anyone has seen TearAway, from the Media Molecule guys who made Little Big Planet.
Check it if you like that sort of thing: [url]https://youtu.be/iaYDNN3VbRQ[/url]
As an illustrator its quite interesting, problem is I'm more of a fussy gamer these days, I hate certain things the gaming world has come to be, like all these mini games and such you can get on tablets, phones, chrome, facebook, quickly churned out games often lacking depth or artistic value, not always but mostly.
I'm also a bit reluctant to play portable games, as im not the kind of person to play games whilst out and about, i dont need to game when im away, it would probably be more a home console, just on the toilet lol, I've also gotten bored of PC gaming, mainly because i have to use a laptop and im not interested in having to update often as it means loosing money each time and im a student.
May go out of my way and get Guild Wars 2 if it runs on my Dell, might have trouble.
So, as broad a question can be, What are you going to play in the next few months leading to the (possible) release of BMS?

item.title: Quenching your BMS Thirst.
item.dc:creator: striker
item.description:
I’ll quench my thirst with Mari0. Let your favorite plumber think with p0rtals (no not Joe the plumber ).
It comes with a full level editor, for even more hours of fun.

item.title: Quenching your BMS Thirst.
item.dc:creator: fgsfds
item.description:
Dunno. Maybe trying to complete some games that i started and never completed. Like FEAR. And those addons for Q2. And Diablo 3. And about three dozen others.
6 months later ROTT will come out (hopefully), so its multiplayer will keep me busy for a long time.

Read full topic

item.title: Quenching your BMS Thirst.
item.dc:creator: Deimos
item.description:
Stu_ark:

#Optimism

So what’s everyone elses plans for gaming over the next 6 months?

Anyone play many Source / UDK Mods? It’s the only thing i really play on PC when i get round to it, but most are often multiplayer based and only active (If at all) for 2 hours a day. Like Goldeneye Source, Come to think of it its a little disappointing how many (Total Conversion) mods dont make a release and it upsets me because it’s really the aspect of PC gaming i love to see. I think most people on sites like MODDB run before they can walk, they have the enthusiasm and talk about how amazing their mod/ideas will be, often get started, do some artwork which is sometimes good, then its silent and hear nothing about it for ages, then its status turns to ‘dead’.

It’s a shame, its such a demanding industry the only outcomes are the ones that have investment behind them, the bar is so high for realism and wide platforms it often cuts out a lot of the interesting and fun experimental stuff.

Like that game, The Unfinished Swan its probably gets a little repetitive and boring, but its probably built on abstract concept that managed to get funding and turned into a real game.

Guild Wars 2
Borderlands 2
Finish Darksiders (again)[/SIZE] & Darksiders 2
Torchlight 2 (hopefully soon)
Dishonored

Should keep my more than busy gaming wise for the next 6 months at least.

Read full topic

item.title: Quenching your BMS Thirst.
item.dc:creator: Stu_ark
item.description:
Dr. Karamazov:

I’ve seen this written before…for the past 3 years. And each time, it was written with such conviction and belief.
Face it, the mod wont be released this year and neither will it be released before March. Yawn.

#Optimism

So what’s everyone elses plans for gaming over the next 6 months?

Anyone play many Source / UDK Mods? It’s the only thing i really play on PC when i get round to it, but most are often multiplayer based and only active (If at all) for 2 hours a day. Like Goldeneye Source, Come to think of it its a little disappointing how many (Total Conversion) mods dont make a release and it upsets me because it’s really the aspect of PC gaming i love to see. I think most people on sites like MODDB run before they can walk, they have the enthusiasm and talk about how amazing their mod/ideas will be, often get started, do some artwork which is sometimes good, then its silent and hear nothing about it for ages, then its status turns to ‘dead’.

It’s a shame, its such a demanding industry the only outcomes are the ones that have investment behind them, the bar is so high for realism and wide platforms it often cuts out a lot of the interesting and fun experimental stuff.

Like that game, The Unfinished Swan its probably gets a little repetitive and boring, but its probably built on abstract concept that managed to get funding and turned into a real game.

Read full topic

item.title: Quenching your BMS Thirst.
item.dc:creator: F_orum_USER
item.description:
The only way to quench the thirst of playing a remake of a classic game… is with other classic games…

I’ll play F-zero and Descent 1 & 2… maybe some more dos games with dosbox.

after i’m tired of those… i’ll play pong

and after that space invaders

and after that pac man

and…

You get the idea… i think…

Read full topic

item.title: Quenching your BMS Thirst.
item.dc:creator: Deimos
item.description:
Dr. Karamazov:

I’ve seen this written before…for the past 3 years. And each time, it was written with such conviction and belief.
Face it, the mod wont be released this year and neither will it be released before March. Yawn.

Anyway, back on topic. It does look like an amusing little game, but I can’t see it being more than a few fun hours.

Black Mesa is confirmed for 2016[/SIZE]
